channel.title: Daniel Dia on Daniel Dia's Personal Website
channel.description: Recent content in Daniel Dia on Daniel Dia's Personal Website

item.title: A Systems Programmer's Case for Rust
item.description: A technical deep-dive into Rust’s core design principles, comparing its approach to memory safety, concurrency, and tooling against C++, Java, and Haskell. We explore why major tech companies are adopting it for critical systems and identify the ideal use cases for the language.

item.title: Project 3 â€“ TRNG-PassGen: A Hardware-Based Cryptographically Secure Password Generator
item.description: A full-stack, end-to-end system for generating cryptographically secure passwords based on true physical randomness, designed to be resilient against quantum computing threats.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
item.description: Member of the full-stack development team, responsible for the end-to-end development of a new web platform for our client LiveLunger.

item.title: LIFE Scholar
item.description: Selected as a scholar for my CCE degree at AUB, recognized for dedication to academic excellence and alignment with LIFE’s mission and values.

item.title: DynamiXplore: A High-Performance Framework for Dynamical Systems
item.description: A Python-first toolkit with a high-performance Rust core for the advanced simulation and analysis of complex dynamical systems, including nonsmooth and chaotic phenomena.

item.title: Online Coursework
item.description: Independent online coursework completed during my undergraduate studies at AUB.

item.title: Undergraduate Coursework at AUB
item.description: All of my undergraduate coursework at AUB.

item.title: Project 2 â€“ A Statically Generated Portfolio and Blog Website
item.description: This project serves as a personal digital space, designed for performance, maintainability, and a clean user experience.

item.title: Book Recommendations
item.description: A curated list of interesting textbooks and resources for aspiring mathematicians and STEM professionals.

item.title: General Undergraduate Advice
item.description: A curated list of advice for aspiring mathematicians and STEM professionals.

item.title: 'Is mathematics discovered or invented?' â€“ My thoughts on the topic
item.description: Is mathematics invented or discovered? Delve into the philosophy of math vs. science, exploring axioms, inductivism, and the ongoing debate over the nature of mathematical truth.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hello! I am Daniel Dia ðŸ‘‹

Welcome to my personal space on the web!

I am a Computer & Communications Engineering (CCE) and Mathematics dual degree student at the American University of Beirut (AUB), driven to apply a strong theoretical foundation to solve complex, real-world problems.

My journey is grounded in a deep fascination with the powerful intersection of mathematics ðŸ“ˆ, software ðŸ’», and electrical engineeringðŸ’¡(and quantitative finance ðŸ§ ). I am passionate about translating advanced theoretical conceptsâ€”from mathematical analysis and linear algebra to information theoryâ€”into high-impact applications.

item.title: Get In Touch
item.description:
For any particular requests, collaborations, or just to say hi, you can reach me (or see my work for that matter) through the following channels:

  • Email: dmd13@mail.aub.edu
  • LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/daniel-dia07/
  • GitHub: github.com/Kibalchish47/
  • ORCiD: https://orcid.org/0009-0003-3301-4302
  • Download my Resume/CV: Here is my resume! (in PDF format)

item.title: Wikipedia Contributor (Volunteer)
item.description: Drove over 1.2 million reader views on edited articles through 150+ enhancements, earning 70+ commendations (’thanks’) from the editorial community.
